intro: Antholyza maura, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Antholyza maura is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
